metadata.title: CVE-2019-11714 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Necko can access a child on the wrong thread during UDP connections,resulting in a potentially exploitable crash in some instances. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11714` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
